item.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning Works - Now What?
item.description: Two years ago, Alex Irpan wrote a post about why “Deep Reinforcement Learning Doesn’t Work Yet”. Since then, we have made huge algorithmic advances, tackling most of the problems raised by Alex. We have methods that are sample efficient [1, 21] and can learn in an off-policy batch setting [22, 23]. When lacking a reward function, we now have methods that can learn from preferences [24, 25] and even methods that are better fit to escape bad local extrema, when the return is non-convex [14, 26].
